content: quote: Originally posted by peter3_1: these 747's are the President's as long as he is President. As they must fly in pairs with the President abord ONE, he must know when BOTH are available at all times, No, he doesn't. Some of his staff does, but not him. They do not actually fly in pairs. One is normally prepositioned to act as a backup usually once the primary acft has left Andrews. If the back-up is needed, it becomes the primary and AF 1 when the President boards. The other one is repaired and now becomes back-up. Here we have one winging around NYC. The question is, 1) As Mr. Obama knew for a fact that one of his 747's was off some where, why did'nt he say so? The flights are coordinated with the White House travel office. They know if any requirements are on the horizon. AFAIK the President is not briefed on daily activities of the VC-25s or any other support acft. 2) If he was uninformed that the 747's were UNAVAILABLE for use, who in the admin. is THAT incompetent? No reason for the President to be briefed on what the planes are doing when he is not using them. Training goes on all the time. Just my observstions from the time I was stationed at Andrews.
quote: Originally posted by peter3_1: these 747's are the President's as long as he is President. As they must fly in pairs with the President abord ONE, he must know when BOTH are available at all times, No, he doesn't. Some of his staff does, but not him. They do not actually fly in pairs. One is normally prepositioned to act as a backup usually once the primary acft has left Andrews. If the back-up is needed, it becomes the primary and AF 1 when the President boards. The other one is repaired and now becomes back-up. Here we have one winging around NYC. The question is, 1) As Mr. Obama knew for a fact that one of his 747's was off some where, why did'nt he say so? The flights are coordinated with the White House travel office. They know if any requirements are on the horizon. AFAIK the President is not briefed on daily activities of the VC-25s or any other support acft. 2) If he was uninformed that the 747's were UNAVAILABLE for use, who in the admin. is THAT incompetent? No reason for the President to be briefed on what the planes are doing when he is not using them. Training goes on all the time.
reply: Just my observstions from the time I was stationed at Andrews.

content: quote: Originally posted by peter3_1: these 747's are the President's as long as he is President. As they must fly in pairs with the President abord ONE, he must know when BOTH are available at all times, No, he doesn't. Some of his staff does, but not him. They do not actually fly in pairs. One is normally prepositioned to act as a backup usually once the primary acft has left Andrews. If the back-up is needed, it becomes the primary and AF 1 when the President boards. The other one is repaired and now becomes back-up. Here we have one winging around NYC. The question is, 1) As Mr. Obama knew for a fact that one of his 747's was off some where, why did'nt he say so? The flights are coordinated with the White House travel office. They know if any requirements are on the horizon. AFAIK the President is not briefed on daily activities of the VC-25s or any other support acft. 2) If he was uninformed that the 747's were UNAVAILABLE for use, who in the admin. is THAT incompetent? No reason for the President to be briefed on what the planes are doing when he is not using them. Training goes on all the time. Just my observstions from the time I was stationed at Andrews.
quote: Originally posted by peter3_1: these 747's are the President's as long as he is President. As they must fly in pairs with the President abord ONE, he must know when BOTH are available at all times, No, he doesn't. Some of his staff does, but not him. They do not actually fly in pairs. One is normally prepositioned to act as a backup usually once the primary acft has left Andrews. If the back-up is needed, it becomes the primary and AF 1 when the President boards. The other one is repaired and now becomes back-up. Here we have one winging around NYC. The question is, 1) As Mr. Obama knew for a fact that one of his 747's was off some where, why did'nt he say so? The flights are coordinated with the White House travel office. They know if any requirements are on the horizon. AFAIK the President is not briefed on daily activities of the VC-25s or any other support acft. 2) If he was uninformed that the 747's were UNAVAILABLE for use, who in the admin. is THAT incompetent? No reason for the President to be briefed on what the planes are doing when he is not using them. Training goes on all the time.
reply: Just my observstions from the time I was stationed at Andrews.
title: Negative Ghost Rider, the pattern is full...or Obama lies.
